sub_topic: Vibrations and oscillations in mechanical systems
message_1: A spring has a mass of 0.25 kilograms hanging from it. The spring has a spring constant of 9 N/m. What is the frequency of the oscillations when the mass is displaced by 0.15 meters from its equilibrium position and released?
message_2:
To find the frequency of the oscillations, we can use the formula for the angular frequency (ω) of a mass-spring system:

ω = √(k/m)

where k is the spring constant (9 N/m) and m is the mass (0.25 kg).

ω = √(9/0.25)
ω ≈ 6 rad/s

Now, we can find the frequency (f) using the relationship between angular frequency and frequency:

f = ω / (2π)

f ≈ 6 / (2π)
f ≈ 0.955 Hz

The frequency of the oscillations when the mass is displaced by 0.15 meters from its equilibrium position and released is approximately 0.955 Hz.
